channel.title: Apocalypse
channel.description: A world where everyone holds the power to employ science and creativity for good.

item.title: The Moment of Impact Show
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: albany theatre wednesday 16th february 2015 1930 – 2100 Tickets: £0/2/4/6/8 (Free or Pay What You Will) Its happening! An asteroid is heading for Earth and its getting closer and closer. Over at Mission Control, a crack team have been trying to figure out whether if there’s a way to Read more…
item.content:encoded:
albany theatre

wednesday 16th february 2015

1930 – 2100

Tickets: £0/2/4/6/8 (Free or Pay What You Will)

Its happening! An asteroid is heading for Earth and its getting closer and closer. Over at Mission Control, a crack team have been trying to figure out whether if there’s a way to avoid Armageddon, but have they managed? You can only find out if you come along and join in the countdown to the Moment of Impact!

This variety extravaganza, will feature an intoxicating mix of performances and events, designed to shock, excite, thrill and make you think about stuff you might not have considered before. Not only will be creating our own comet, live on stage, showing you how you can throw yourself out of a 2 story window without injury, scan your brain for evidence of activity using a set of kitchen scales, and how to protect yourself from a possible invasion of zombies. We will also feature the winner of our open-mic “SING FOR YOUR LIFE” competition and be showing the premier of our short drama “ZOMBIES INVASION: LEWISHAM” Tickets are free or pay what you can and this is suitable for 12+ to adult. There will be a pay bar.

Zombie Run – Promo Pic

item.title: End of the World Cabaret: Monday 16th February
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: The End of The World is Nigh! Who you gonna call? Well put it this way – if you only have a few hours left until certain death you might as well enjoy yourself. Albany Theatre Monday 16th February 2000-2300 TICKETS £5/10 FOR ONE NIGHT ONLY, Mat Ricardo will be Read more…
item.content:encoded:
The End of The World is Nigh! Who you gonna call? Well put it this way – if you only have a few hours left until certain death you might as well enjoy yourself.

Albany Theatre

Monday 16th February 2000-2300

TICKETS £5/10

FOR ONE NIGHT ONLY, Mat Ricardo will be hosting the End of the World Cabaret – a place to enjoy your final few hours, steep yourself in amazing acts of gravity-defying physical dexterity, laugh, be entertained by some of the greatest variety acts in London. Also featuring Voice of an Angle, Helen Arney from Festival of the Spoken Nerd and Coco Malone, who will sing us into possible Armageddon! Tiernan Douieb and Chella Quint will also bring their own special brand of astronomical humour to the evening, and you can finish off with some wine and some stargazing. What’s not to like!

item.title: The Intergalactic Travel Bureau
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Intergalactic Travel Bureau Monday 16th February 2015 – 1200-1800 (DROP-IN) wednesday 18TH FEBRUARY 2015 – 1000-1800 (DROP-IN) ALBANY THEATRE (purple room) An asteroid is heading for London – it might be time to think about a little getaway – maybe as far, far away as possible? Welcome to the Intergalactic Travel Read more…
item.content:encoded:
Intergalactic Travel Bureau

Monday 16th February 2015 – 1200-1800 (DROP-IN)
wednesday 18TH FEBRUARY 2015 – 1000-1800 (DROP-IN)

ALBANY THEATRE (purple room)

An asteroid is heading for London – it might be time to think about a little getaway – maybe as far, far away as possible?

Welcome to the Intergalactic Travel Bureau, the resource for all your luxury space travel needs. We cater to your unique desires when selecting a destination. 

The Intergalactic Travel Bureau is a live, interactive experience that explores the incredible possibilities of space tourism. It’s a little bit like Virgin Galactic and Space X meet the Jetsons and Mad Men.

This February we invite you to come visit and let us plan your vacation to another planet! For shorter getaways, might we suggest a short stay on Earth’s moon. With gravity about one sixth that of the Earth, you can enjoy moon-jumping from the comfort of your climate controlled hotel room, while the moon’s synchronous rotation provides a constant view of our home planet from your hotel window.

If you’re serious about skiing, imagine flying down the black runs of Pluto. For those who enjoy scuba diving, we suggest searching for sea life in Europa’s chilly subsurface ocean. But these are just a handful of the numerous destinations both inside and outside Earth’s solar system, and our agents would be delighted to discuss all your options with you.

Once you have selected your destination, our agents will be happy to discuss pricing, time commitments, and logistics with you to make sure your vacation is ideal for you in every detail.

The Intergalactic Travel Bureau brings together space scientists, astronomers, science educators and actors to SMASHfestUK unique, personalised, immersive spac- vacation planning experiences.

item.title: Crowdsourcing An Apocalypse
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: SMASHfestUK has been created to engage young people in STEM subjects through participatory stories, and activities. These activities will eventually manifest as parts of a strong crowdsourced narrative. Some of our potential participants have already started working on their involvement in the festival. Here are students at the Middlesex University Read more…
item.content:encoded:
SMASHfestUK has been created to engage young people in STEM subjects through participatory stories, and activities. These activities will eventually manifest as parts of a strong crowdsourced narrative.

Some of our potential participants have already started working on their involvement in the festival. Here are students at the Middlesex University gearing up for the final showdown…

Showdown at Preparations Middlesex Uni
